org.webchecker.watcher

Class ListenerConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.webchecker.watcher.ListenerConfig

  • public class ListenerConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Class represents a configuration of a listener. It contains only one parameter yet, but can be easily extend. There is no rule of number of listeners to one config, but one listener have to have exact one config.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    MatÄ›j Kripner <kripnermatej@gmail.com>
    See Also:
    Listener

    • Field Detail

      • MIN_AUTO_CHECKING

        public static final int MIN_AUTO_CHECKING
        Min value of auto checking delay. Has to be positive.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaults

        public static ListenerConfig getDefaults()
        Returns new config in the default state.
        Returns:
        new config in the default state

      • autoCheckingOn

        public ListenerConfig autoCheckingOn(int delay)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Turn auto checking on with the given delay.

        The given delay has to be valid. In fact, delay is valid when: delay >= {@link #MIN_AUTO_CHECKING}

        Parameters:
        delay - the new value of delay between two listening of a listener
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if validation of the given delay fails
        See Also:
        validateDelay(int)

      • autoCheckingOff

        public ListenerConfig autoCheckingOff()
        Turn the auto checking off.
        Returns:
        this

      • getAutoChecking

        public int getAutoChecking()
        Simply return value of auto checking attribute. If auto checking is off, return zero.
        Returns:
        value of auto checking attribute

      • isAutoCheckingOn

        public boolean isAutoCheckingOn()
        Tests that auto checking is on.
        Returns:
        auto checking is on

      • setOnAutoCheckingChange

        public void setOnAutoCheckingChange(java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> onAutoCheckingChange)
        Simple sets the value of auto checking change function attribute to given value.
        Parameters:
        onAutoCheckingChange - new value of auto checking change function attribute
